Package org.moddingx.libx.datagen.provider.texture

Class TextureProviderBase

java.lang.Object
org.moddingx.libx.datagen.provider.texture.TextureProviderBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
net.minecraft.data.DataProvider
public abstract class TextureProviderBase extends Object implements net.minecraft.data.DataProvider
A provider to generate textures during datagen. When using this, notice the difference between a texture id and an image id. A texture id is a ResourceLocation holding the namespace and the path of a texture as it is used in block and item models. An image id is a ResourceLocation in the format that is passed to TextureManager.getTexture(ResourceLocation). A texture id is converted to an image id like this: namespace:textures/path.png.

Scaling

This provider takes care that a resulting texture is scaled up as much as required to fit all the textures used to build that texture on it. Scales are always positive integers as the provider expects textures to have widths and heights that are powers of 2. The target scale is defined as the amount that the requested size has been scaled up, so all required texture can fit on it. The image passed in TextureFactory.generate(BufferedImage, Textures) will always have the requested size times the target scale. A source image scale is defined as the amount that a source image needs to be scaled up to match the target image. To register textures that should be generated, use one of the texture and image methods during setup().
